issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: DataNode configuration {{DNConf}} reading in   {{HdfsClientConfigKeys.DFS_CLIENT_SLOW_IO_WARNING_THRESHOLD_KEY}} (_dfs.client.slow.io.warning.threshold.ms_) is redundant as this threshold limit is needed only for {{DfsClientConf}}. Better to remove the unwanted usage in DNConf.

comments.body: Attached v01 patch to remove redundant client threshold config read and usage in DNConf.

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~manojg] for catching this. I am thinking if we can remove another unused variable {{writePacketSize}} in {{DNConf.java}}. This variable has been defined in {{DfsClientConf}} and it mainly used by hdfs-client.

Thanks for the review  [~eddyxu]. Sure, DFSConfigKeys#DFS_CLIENT_SLOW_IO_WARNING_THRESHOLD_DEFAULT was already deprecated on 2.8.0 release and I believe its safe to remove this config key.

Attached v02 patch removing the deprecated DFS_CLIENT_SLOW_IO_WARNING_THRESHOLD_DEFAULT in DFSConfigKeys. Kindly take a look.

This message was automatically generated.
TestDataNodeVolumeFailureReporting timeout failure is not related to the patch.

Hi, [~manojg]

Do you need to also delete {{DFSConfigKeys#DFS_CLIENT_SLOW_IO_WARNING_THRESHOLD_DEFAULT}}?

Thanks for the review [~eddyxu], [~linyiqun]. 
Attached v03 patch addressing the following
* Removed DFS_CLIENT_SLOW_IO_WARNING_THRESHOLD_* from DFSConfigKeys
* Removed writePacketSize from DNConf and its corresponding DFS_CLIENT_WRITE_PACKET_SIZE_* from DFSConfigKeys

Kindly take a look the latest patch. 

PS: DFSConfigKeys has several other references to HdfsClientConfigKeys constants and they are all Deprecated. This jira is not cleaning up the deprecated items in DFSConfigKeys.
